summary: The Graham Hoffman Act amends Title 18 of the United States Code to punish crimes targeting first responders. It defines "first responders" and outlines specific circumstances under which such assaults warrant federal prosecution. Penalties include imprisonment and fines, with harsher sentences for offenses resulting in death, kidnapping attempts, or attempts to kill. The bill also includes a certification requirement for federal prosecution, mandates that the Attorney General or designee approve prosecution, and defines the term "State."
